sentences.chinese: 有夷山，故曰夷陵，今硤州縣也，故城在今縣西北。
sentences.literal: There is Mount Yi, hence it is called Yiling; it is now Xiazhou County, with its ancient city northwest of the present county.)
sentences.idiomatic: The place takes its name from Mount Yi, hence 'Yiling'; it's now Xiazhou County, with its old city lying northwest of the modern county.)

sentences.literal: ) They all appointed generals and commanders, invading and plundering commanderies and counties.
sentences.idiomatic: ) Each set up their own leadership structure, raiding and seizing commanderies and counties.

sentences.chinese: 又別號諸賊銅馬、大肜、高湖、重連、鐵脛、大搶、尤來、上江、青犢、五校、檀郷、五幡、五樓、富平、獲索等，〈諸賊或以山川土地為名，或以軍容彊盛為號。
sentences.literal: Additionally, the various bandits were separately known as the Copper Horse, Great Vessel, High Lake, Heavy Link, Iron Shin, Great Robber, Especially Come, Upper Jiang, Green Calf, Five Schools, Tan Township, Five Banners, Five Towers, Rich Plain, and Obtain Rope groups. (The various bandits sometimes took names from mountains, rivers, and lands, or from their military appearance and strength.)
sentences.idiomatic: The bandits also went by various names: Copper Horse, Great Vessel, High Lake, Heavy Link, Iron Shin, Great Robber, Especially Come, Upper Jiang, Green Calf, Five Schools, Tan Township, Five Banners, Five Towers, Rich Plain, and Obtain Rope. (Some took their names from geographical features, others from their formidable military bearing.)

sentences.chinese: 銅馬賊帥東山荒禿、上淮況等，大肜渠帥樊重，尤來渠帥樊崇，五校賊帥高扈，檀郷賊帥董次仲，五樓賊帥張文，富平賊帥徐少，獲索賊帥古師郎等，並見東觀記。
sentences.literal: The Copper Horse bandit leaders were Dongshan Huangtu, Shang Huaikuang, and others; the Great Vessel leader was Fan Zhong; the Especially Come leader was Fan Chong; the Five Schools bandit leader was Gao Hu; the Tan Township bandit leader was Dong Cizhong; the Five Towers bandit leader was Zhang Wen; the Rich Plain bandit leader was Xu Shao; the Obtain Rope bandit leader was Gu Shilang; and others—all appear in the Dongguan Record.)
sentences.idiomatic: The leaders of the Copper Horse bandits included Dongshan Huangtu and Shang Huaikuang; Fan Zhong led the Great Vessel group; Fan Chong led Especially Come; Gao Hu led Five Schools; Dong Cizhong led Tan Township; Zhang Wen led Five Towers; Xu Shao led Rich Plain; Gu Shilang led Obtain Rope—and all these are recorded in the Dongguan Record.)

sentences.chinese: 〉各領部曲，〈《續漢志》曰：「大將軍營有五部，部三校尉。
sentences.literal: ) Each led their own buqu. (The Continued Book of Han states: 'The Grand General's camp has five bu, each bu has three colonels.')
sentences.idiomatic: ) Each commanded their own military units. (According to the Continued Book of Han: 'The Grand General's encampment consists of five divisions, each division having three colonels.')

sentences.chinese: 部下有曲，曲有軍候一人。」
sentences.literal: Under each bu there are qu, and each qu has one army inspector.')
sentences.idiomatic: Each division contains companies, and each company has one military officer.')
